definitions.definition: To find or learn something for the first time.
examples: Turning the corner, I discovered a lovely little shop. I discovered that they sold widgets.

definitions.definition: To remove the cover from; to uncover (a head, building etc.).

examples: The gust of wind discovered a bone in the sand.

definitions.definition: To create by moving a piece out of another piece's line of attack .
examples: This move discovers an attack on a vital pawn.

definitions.definition: To question (a person) as part of discovery in a lawsuit .
To reveal (information); to divulge , make known .
examples: I discovered my plans to the rest of the team.

definitions.definition: To manifest without design ; to show ; to exhibit .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To find or learn something for the first time.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , obsolete ) To remove the cover from; to uncover (a head, building etc.).
( transitive , now rare ) To expose , uncover .
( transitive , chess ) To create by moving a piece out of another piece's line of attack .
( transitive , law ) To question (a person) as part of discovery in a lawsuit .
( transitive , archaic ) To reveal (information); to divulge , make known .
( transitive , obsolete ) To reconnoitre , explore (an area).
( transitive , obsolete ) To manifest without design ; to show ; to exhibit .
